conclusion: The problem involves maximizing the power-source output efficiency using resistors R1 and R2.
The graph shows the terminal voltage U as a function of current I for a power source and resistors R1 and R2.
The graph has two lines representing the voltage-current relationships for resistors R1 and R2.
The intersection of the lines R1 and R2 indicates the point where the product of V and I is maximized.
The maximum power output occurs when the current I is 2 A and the terminal voltage V is 2 V.
Connecting R1 and R2 in series with each having a resistance of 1 Ω results in a total resistance of 2 Ω.
This configuration results in a current of 2 A and a terminal voltage of 2 V, giving a maximum power output of 4 W.
The answer is to connect R1 and R2 in series, with each having a resistance of 1 Ω.
